item.title: Absinthe Tails - behind the screens
item.description: BRIEF OVERVIEW OF THE GAME Take a sip of absinthe, and join this green-hued quest for a lost, fuzzy kitten. Absinthe Tails is a detective game with a dash of absinthe and missing cats. As Claude, a detective with a penchant for spirits, your task is to unravel the mysteries surrounding your quaint town. Armed with photographs from around the town and vibrant dreams to supplement your alcohol-clouded memory, you must piece together the clues to solve the case.

item.title: How should I look today! - behind the screens
item.description: BRIEF OVERVIEW Enter the shoes of a social media traveller, eager to discover a land renowned for its unique apple varieties. Your mission: purchase an apple. But blending in proves difficult as locals eye you with suspicion. Can you convince them of your harmless intentions, or will it lead to dire consequences? Objective The assignment delves into the repercussions of standing out in a crowd , inspired by a real-life incident with severe consequences, prompting exploration of the emotions and reactions triggered when one is perceived as different among peers .

item.title: How should I look today! - a game poem
item.description: Overview Enter the shoes of a social media traveller, eager to discover a land renowned for its unique apple varieties. Your mission: purchase an apple. But blending in proves difficult as locals eye you with suspicion. Can you convince them of your harmless intentions, or will it lead to dire consequences? MY ROLE as Game Designer This project was inspired by Jordan Magnuson’s game poems. Dedicated to the events of the Diphu incident of 2018, the game poem delves into the complexities of human behavior towards those unfamiliar to them, encompassing aspects such as appearance, food, culture, and geography.

item.title: HEATWAVE Havoc - A multiplayer cooperative game
item.description: Overview BACKGROUND How might we make the younger generation aware of the impacts of heatwaves? How might we aid them to build empathy for our changing world and people effected by it? How might we make them aware of the adaptation measures during such an event? OBJECTIVE The main goal of this project is to share adaptation measures to be taken during the event of a heatwave. PRODUCT DETAILS HEATWAVE Havoc is a multiplayer card based strategic cooperative game, where you save all your cute little babies from the effects of heatwaves.

OBJECTIVE The main goal of this project was to teach participants about folk musical instruments through their sounds, method of construction, relationship with different communities and their festivals

item.title: Zuci - A Phy-gital multiplayer turn based strategy game
item.description: INTRODUCTION Folk musical instruments bind one’s community together. Within a community, each instrument has its own specific use, place and time to be played. However, with the popularization of new electronic musical instruments and music, the audience base of traditional folk musical instruments have decreased considerably . To gather more information about the same, we met with Brahmaputra cultural Foundation(BCF), an NGO who is working on conserving folk musical instruments of the North-eastern states of India.

item.title: Sharing knowledge about Folk musical instruments
item.description: Overview BACKGROUND Traditional folk musical instruments are facing extinction in many parts of India due to decrease in its user base. In order to develop a future user base of people with a better awareness of these musical instruments, the goal of this study was to identify an effective medium for teaching younger audiences about these instruments’ construction processes, sounds, and events they are played at. OBJECTIVE Through this study we aim to introduce different mediums of instruction to children above age of 8 years and observe how they respond to them.

item.title: Nature's palette - a playful adventure
item.description: Overview BACKGROUND Can we foster curiosity in children about our natural environment? item.title: Flowers peep - Imagining people as flowers
item.description: Overview BACKGROUND Flower project started as a discussion with my then manager at Eli Lilly India, Anand Sawkar . We were talking about data visualisation when the topic changed to whether it was possible to find out who in our company like superhero movies. Then we began to consider whether we might create a humorous data visualisation to determine whether people at Lilly have similar interests. Would it start discussions? Assemble players to play football during weekends?

item.title: Visualizing radiology data - Predible health report
item.description: Overview BACKGROUND Predible Health is an AI startup, now acquired by nference. They work with Artificial Intelligence to draw out information from Radiology data. We collaborated on a project to create physical reports for the users – Pulmonologist, radiologist, and patients. PRODUCT DETAILS The project’s goal was to discover an efficient approach to incorporate the data from a lung computed tomography(CT) scan into a medical report that was tailored specifically for our intended audience. Three categories — Nodule analysis data, Low Attenuation analysis data, and High Attenuation analysis data—were used to separate the information we intended to provide.

item.title: 600 years of Ahom Kingdom - a visual data narrative
item.description: Overview BACKGROUND The Ahom dynasty was the most celebrated in Assam’s history. With a successful reign of 600 years they were able to enrich Assam with agriculture, architecture, cultural richness and different scientific interventions. Ahoms were the descendants of Tai or Shan race who came from Mungmao, currently in Yunan province of China. They came to Brahmaputra Valley of North East India in 1228. The kingdom of Ahoms established during 13th century entails an important part of the Assamese history.

item.title: Mukha Shilpa - Mask making of Majuli Island
item.description: Overview BACKGROUND Majuli district (27.0016° N, 94.2243° E) is a river island in Assam, surrounded by the river Brahmaputra. The island is a beautiful landscape of nature with land and aquatic flora and fauna, inhibited by different tribal and non tribal communities. The river island was influenced by the then Vaishnavait movement of Assam with the establishment of a satra at Dhuwahat by the saint Shankardeva.The art of Mask making has been an exquisite culture of Majuli satras.

item.title: Bondeep, Bonoshreehotor Golpo - book design
item.description: OVERVIEW My father has been writing short tales for children and publishing them in local Assamese publications for as long as I can remember. “Bondeep, Bonoshreehotor Golpo” (Bondeep, Bonoshree’s Tales) is a collection of short stories created and collected to raise awareness about the preservation of our natural environment. I consider myself fortunate to have assisted him with the typesetting and design of this book. The book will be available at local bookstores on December 6, 2022.

item.title: My friend Mr Leakey - book design
item.description: OVERVIEW Author J. B. S. Haldane and his book My Friend Mr Leakey always fascinated me. It has been one of my favorite books. During my Master’s we were asked to redesign any of our favorite books. It came as a perfect opportunity to design it in a way I imagined the world of Mr Leakey would look like. I hope you enjoy this design as much as I loved working on it! Snapshots of the book Illustrations within FIN.
